title.narrative: DRA - Central African Republic Joint Response 6

description.narrative: cc

title.narrative: N - LOC-R1 - % of budget that went to national and local actors

description.narrative: 5% of the direct budget will go to the local implementing partner. As part of the localization strategy, implementation of activities is done hand in hand.

title.narrative: % of budget that went to national and local actors

description.narrative: part of national and local actors

title.narrative: H - PRO-R10 - Number of advocacy products produced and disseminated AND/OR number of meetings/events held

description.narrative: Advocacy on child protection during, for example, womens rights day, human rights day, youth day, during back to school campaign and so on.

title.narrative: Number of advocacy products produced and disseminated AND/OR number of meetings/events held

description.narrative: part of protection advocacy

title.narrative: J - PRO-R13 - Number of persons who obtain appropriate documentation/legal status

description.narrative: As part of the safe school approach for chilldren protection, birth certificates and supplementary judgments for 220 children are arranged.

title.narrative: Number of people that obtain birth certificates

description.narrative: part of documentation, status and protection of individuals

title.narrative: B - PRO-R1 - Number of persons reached by the implementation of specific prevention measures

description.narrative: Casemanagement including individual analysis and cash support. SOS RCA will provide conditional and unrestricted cash to the families of the children as part of case management.

title.narrative: Number of people that received conditional unrestricted cash support as part of case management

description.narrative: part of prevention and response to voilence

title.narrative: E - PRO-R6 - Number of participants showing an increased knowledge on child protection

description.narrative: Community members (RECOPE, local NGO’s and others) are trained on child protection issues and cross-cutting themes like human rights, SGBV, IHL, social cohesion, life skills.

title.narrative: Number of participants showing an increased knowledge on child protection

description.narrative: part of capacity building protection

title.narrative: C - PRO-R2 - Number of persons who receive an appropriate response

description.narrative: Conflict-affected people that receive mediation, medical reference, psychosocial consult (PSS) and family visits.

title.narrative: Number op people that receive PSS

description.narrative: part of prevention and response to violence

title.narrative: M - PRO-R15 - Number of children that received support specified to their needs

description.narrative: Crisis-affected children (including IDP, returnees, host communities) are registered to participate in Child Friendly Spaces. This includes the provision of creative activities, educational activities, sports activities, mental health and psychosocial support.

title.narrative: Number of children participating in CFS

description.narrative: part of child protection

title.narrative: F - PRO-R8 - Number of unaccompanied and/or separated children who are reunited with their caregivers or in appropriate protective care arrangements based on best interest

description.narrative: Identification, Tracking, Tracing, Reunification (IDTR) system for the holistic management of Unaccompanied and Seperated Children (UASC), 20 UASC are temporarily cared for in supported temporary care families and reunified with their biological/extended families if/when possible. Including cash for temporary families.

title.narrative: Number of unaccompanied and/or separated children who are reunited with their caregivers or in appropriate protective care arrangements

description.narrative: part of support to separated/unaccompanied children

title.narrative: P - LOC-R3 - Number of national and local actors supported with capacity-building

description.narrative: Local Actors (NGO, Authorities, community, schools) will participate to capacity-building initiatives on SGBV, Child Protection, PSS, case management, CFS management, sensitization/communication technics,Human Rights, HI and social cohesion.

title.narrative: Number of national and local actors supported with capacity-building

description.narrative: part of capacity building reach

title.narrative: I - PRO-R11 - Number of persons reached by specific GBV prevention measures

description.narrative: People are sensitized on SGBV prevention mechanisms.

title.narrative: Number of persons reached by specific GBV prevention measures

description.narrative: part of gender based violence (Prevention, response, other)

title.narrative: K - PRO-R12 - Number of survivors who receive an appropriate response to GBV

description.narrative: SGBV survivors receive tailor-made Psycho Social SUpport potentiallly incluing a dignity KIT and support for income generating activity.

title.narrative: Number of survivors who receive an appropriate response to GBV

description.narrative: part of gender based violence (Prevention, response, other)

title.narrative: D - PRO-R5 - Number of persons with increased/appropriate information on relevant rights and/or entitlements

description.narrative: Sensitisation on community protection mechanisms via radio campaigns and community meetings. Including information on child protection, child rights and more specifically, child abuse and survirors from violence, exploitation, neglect and abuse (SGBV) and referral mechanism. Additional distribution of information and training of community leaders and local authorities (training of trainers).

title.narrative: Number of persons with increased/appropriate information on relevant rights and/or entitlements

description.narrative: part of protection information dissemination

title.narrative: O - LOC-R2 - % of budget spent on capacity building of national an local actors

description.narrative: This is the % budget with which training is conducted.

title.narrative: % of budget spent on capacity building of national an local actors

description.narrative: part of capacity building (localisation)

title.narrative: L - PRO-R14 - Number of persons separated from their family who have re-established and maintained contacts AND/OR have been reunified with their families

description.narrative: UASC are reunified with their family

title.narrative: Number of UASC reunified with their families

description.narrative: part of tracing and reunification

title.narrative: A - FSC-R1 - Number of people provided with resources to protect and start rebuilding livelihood assets

description.narrative: Vulnerable youth receives vocational training and a KIT to start their business; SGBV survivors and RECOPE members receive income-generating activity support.

title.narrative: Number of people that received appropriate support

description.narrative: part of rebuilding livilhoods

title.narrative: G - PRO-R9 - Number of persons receiving detention visits

description.narrative: Women and children in detention receive visits from staff, two visits per week approximately.

title.narrative: Number of persons receiving detention visits

description.narrative: part of Detention

title.narrative: Q - ACC-R1 - Number of crisis-affected people who are also involved in the design, implementation, monitoring and/or evaluation of the programme

description.narrative: community members from the 6 project localities that are involved in the project design, monitoring, management and evaluation.

title.narrative: Number of crisis-affected people who are also involved in the design, implementation, monitoring and/or evaluation of the programme

description.narrative: part of participation

title.narrative: R - ACC-R2 - Number of adaptations in the design and/or implementation of the JR, as a result of the input from beneficiaries.

description.narrative: number of adaptions in program resulting from input of beneficiaries

title.narrative: Number of adaptations in the design and/or implementation of the JR, as a result of the input from beneficiaries.

description.narrative: part of adaptions to JR
